channel.title: Configuration on ShowyEdge
channel.description: Recent content in Configuration on ShowyEdge

item.title: Open preferences window
item.description: Open Preferences from menu bar. Note If you’ve hidden the menu bar icon, open ShowyEdge again from Launchpad while ShowyEdge is already running to open preferences window.

item.title: Input source color configuration
item.description: You can change indicator colors of input sources. Open preferences window. Press Add custom color button on Preferences. Change colors.

item.title: Indicator size configuration
item.description: Basic You can change the indicator height. Open preferences window. Choose Indicator from the sidebar. Adjust height. Advanced You can put the indicator by custom size and origin. Open preferences window. Choose Custom Frame from the sidebar. Enable Use custom frame, and then adjust the indicator size and origin. Tips You can specify size by pixel or percentage of screen. (e.g., width = 100%, height = 20pt) Choose Lower-Left from origin options if you want to put indicator to the bottom of screen.

item.title: Indicator options
item.description: Hide indicator when full screen Show indicator behind app windows This option is useful with custom frame. You can use the Desktop background as an indicator.

item.title: Open at login
item.description: You can launch ShowyEdge automaticaly at login. Open preferences window. Enable Open at login.

item.title: Hide the icon in menu bar
item.description: You can hide the icon in menu bar from preferences. Open preferences window. Turn off Show icon in menu bar.
